title: I am writing a book series and the first book is written in third person. Would it be all right to switch the second book into first person, or is that too confusing for readers? - Quora

response.answer_text: It depends on why you’re doing it. If you just want to switch of they style in which you’re writing, maybe do that somewhere that isn’t a direct sequel. Of course, even then you can still do it. You’ll just have to give a reason for the shift to your readers. This is easier if you’re doing it for story purposes. A shift in perspective grounded in the story can both explain the change and provide an interesting shift for your readers.

I could be brilliant, if (!) it serves a purpose. If the reason is only “in hindsight I wish that I wrote the first book in first person too”, then don’t switch. But if you aim to highlight a trait of the protagonist that wasn’t visible in the first book because it was written in third person, then by all means do it!
